Meanings: One of Archie's classification for different types of Carbonate rocks for visible porosity under 10x microscope, some visible porosity with the size larger than 2mm, joints or cavity
یکی از مقیاس‌های طبقه بندی آرچی که مشخص کننده سنگی است که تحت بزرگنمایی 10 میکروسکپ تخلخلی با اندازه بزرگتر از دو میلیمتر مشاهده می‌گردد
چاهی که خشک بوده و آنرا رها نموده اند
drill cement, actions or job's abbreviation which Companymans write in reports
اختصار در مورد عملیاتی است که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
drill Formation, actions or job's abbreviation which Companymans write in reports
اختصار در مورد عملیاتی است که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
drilled out, also write as : DO
اختصار در مورد عملیاتی است که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
drill & Slide, actions or job's abbreviation which Companymans write in reports
حفاری و اسلاید نوعی حفاری که بروش لغزیدن انجام می‌شود که بیشتر در حفاری مایل بکار برده می‌شود
اختصار در مورد عملیاتی است که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
که کمپانی من یا ناظر حفاری آنرا بصورت روزانه تنظیم می‌نماید

A unit of Permeability. A porous medium has a Permeability of 1 Darcy when a Pressure of one 1 atmosphere is applied to force a liquid of one 1 cP Viscosity through a sample one 1 cm long and one 1 cm² in cross section at a rate of one 1 cm³ per second

n: A unit of measure of permeability. A porous medium has a permeability of 1 darcy when differential pressure of 1 atmosphere across a sample 1 centimeter long and 1 square centimeter in cross section will force a liquid of 1 centipoise of viscosity through the sample at the rate of 1 cm³ per second. The permeability of reservoir rocks is usually so low that it is measured in Millidarcys
سوپروایزر یا ناظر حفاری ارشد شیفت روز یا کمپانی من روز
نرخ روزانه برای حفاری یا کار روزانه
کالیپر دوگانه اندازه گیری قطر چاه‌های نفت و گاز توسط لاگ
DIELECTRIC CONSTANT LOG, Log Curve name
Time actually spent for drilling cement plugs, Operations' abbreviation which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
drilled deeper, actions or job's abbreviations which Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
Directional drilling, mostly write as : DIR
حفاری مایل یا جهت دار یا کج
اختصار در مورد عملیاتی است که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
Lost time due to Directional Drilling problem. Directional control & Trajectory, Operations' abbreviation which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
GAMMA RAY DENSITY/CALIPER, Log Curve name
DUAL DETECTOR LOG, Log Curve name
DUAL DETECTOR/NEUTRON LIFETIME LOG, Log Curve name
نفت مرده یا نفت جامد شده باقیمانده در نمونه سنگ
Crude Oil containing essentially no dissolved Gas when it is produced
که کمپانی من یا ناظر حفاری آنرا بصورت روزانه تنظیم می‌نماید
Drilling Engineering Association, abbreviation, and in German Language : Deutsche Erdol Aktiengesellschaft : © Oxford University Press,
DEA with capital letters is abbreviation of Drilling Engineering Association, also in general : Drug Enforcement Administration or Agency
Crude Oil containing essentially no dissolved Gas when it is produced
نفت مرده یا نفت جامد شده باقیمانده در نمونه سنگ
Crude Oil containing essentially no dissolved Gas when it is produced
ddo, also rarely write as : dead o
نفت مرده یا نفت جامد شده باقیمانده در نمونه سنگ
A well that will not flow
A change in the angle of a wellbore. In directional drilling, it is measured in degrees from the vertical
The device used to remove unwanted gas from a liquid, especially from drilling fluid
ρ, letter for showing density in formulas

The mass or weight of a substance per unit volume. For instance, the density of a drilling mud may be 10 pounds per gallon ppg , 74.8 pounds per cubic foot lb/ft , or 1,198.2 kilograms per cubic meter kg/m³ . Specific gravity, relative density, and API gravity are other units of density

A device used to measure the depth of a well or the depth at a specific point in a well such as to the top of a liner or to a fish by counting the turns of a calibrated wheel rolling on a wireline as it is lowered into or pulled out of the well

bearing structure, usually of bolted construction. In drilling, the standard derrick has four legs standing at the corners of the substructure and reaching to the crown block. The substructure is an assembly of heavy beams used to elevate the derrick and provide space to install blowout preventers, casingheads, and so forth. Because the standard derrick must be assembled piece by piece, it has largely been replaced by the mast, which can be lowered and raised without disassembly

The crew member who handles the upper end of the drill string as it is being hoisted out of or lowered into the hole. He is also responsible for the circulating machinery and the conditioning of the drilling fluid
A centrifugal device for removing sand from drilling fluid to prevent abrasion of the pumps. It may be operated mechanically or by a fast
moving stream of fluid inside a special cone

a centrifugal device for removing very fine particles, or silt, from drilling fluids to keep the amount of solids in the fluid at the lowest possible point. Usually, the lower the solids content of mud, the faster is the rate of penetration. The desilter work on the same principle as a desander. Compare desander
یک برنامه کامپیوتری که بصورت تلفیقی با نرم افزار کوریبند بکار برده میشود
A computer program, to be used in conjunction with CORIBAND
A word used in reference to Sediments or Sedimentary rocks that are composed of particles which were transported and deposited by wind, water or ice
detrital, A word used in reference to Sediments or Sedimentary rocks that are composed of particles which were transported and deposited by wind, water or ice
A well drilled in proven territory in a field to complete a pattern of production

Departure of the wellbore from the vertical, measured by the horizontal distance from the rotary table to the target. The amount of deviation is a function of the drift angle and hole depth. The term is sometimes used to indicate the angle from which a bit has deviated from the vertical during drilling
عملیات بدست آوردن تمایل چاه در فواصل مختلف
An operation made to determine the angle from which a bit has deviated from the vertical during drilling. There are two basic deviation
survey, instruments: one reveals the drift angle; the other indicates both the angle and the direction of deviation
DUAL FOCUS ELECTRIC, Log Curve name
ARM DIP FRACTURE PROFILE, Log Curve name
Time actually spent for drilling Float Collar and Shoe, Operations' abbreviation which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
DUAL GUARD FORXO LOG, Log Curve name
DUAL GUARD LOG, Log Curve name
موتوری که در ته چاه جهت حفاری مایل استفاده می‌شود

Time actually spent for Opening or Under Reaming an existing pilot Hole, rotating time of the Bit at the bottom, Operations' abbreviation which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports

n: A collar or coupling of tool steel, threaded internally, that can be used to retrieve pipe from the well on fishing jobs; the female counterpart of a taper tap. The die collar is made up on the drill pipe and lowered into the hole until it contacts the lost pipe. If the lost pipe is stuck so that it cannot rotate, rotation of the die collar on top of the pipe cuts threads on the outside of the pipe, providing a firm attachment. The pipe is then retrieved from the hole. Compare taper tap. It is not often used because it is difficult to release it from the fish should it become necessary

The difference between two fluid pressures; for example, the difference between the pressure in a reservoir and in a wellbore drilled in the reservoir, or between atmospheric pressure at sea level and at 10,000 feet

A condition in which the drill stem becomes stuck against the wall of the wellbore because part of the drill stem usually the drill collars has become embedded in the filter cake. necessary conditions for differential

pressure sticking, or wall sticking, are a permeable formation and a pressure differential across a nearly impermeable filter cake and drill stem. Also called wall sticking. See differential pressure, filter cake
DUAL INDUCTION FOCUSED LOG, Log Curve name
DUAL INDUCTION GUARD LOG, Log Curve name
DUAL INDUCTION LATEROLOG 8, Log Curve name
DUAL INDUCTION LATERAL, Log Curve name
Directional drilling, actions or job's abbreviation which Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
اختصار در مورد عملیاتی است که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد

Intentional deviation of a wellbore from the vertical. Although wellbores are normally drilled vertically, it is sometimes necessary or advantageous to drill at an angle from the vertical. Controlled directional drilling makes is possible to reach subsurface areas laterally remote from the point where the bit enters the earth. It often involves the use of turbodrills, Dyna
Drills, whipstocks, or other deflecting rods
DIR, actions or jobs which Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
معمولا اختصار این لغت در مورد عملیاتی بکار میرود که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
A logging method that records rift angle, or deflection from the vertical, and direction of the drift. A single

survey instrument makes a single photograph of a compass reading of the draft direction and the number of degrees the hole is off vertical. A multishot survey instrument obtains numerous readings in the hole as the device is pulled out of the well. See also : directional drilling
A substance added to cement that chemically wets the cement particles in the slurry, allowing the slurry to flow easily without much water
The weight of a fluid such as water displaced by a freely floating or submerged body such as an offshore drilling rig . if the body floats, the displacement equals the weigh of the body
. replacement of one fluid by another in the pore space of a reservoir. For example, oil may be displaced by water
A well through which water usually salt water is returned to subsurface formations
Natural gas which is in solution with crude oil in the reservoir
PHASOR INDUCTION LOG/DUAL INDUCTION MODEL E, Log Curve name

A device used to direct fluid flowing from a well away from the drilling rig. When a kick is encountered at shallow depths, the well often cannot be shut in safely; therefore, a diverter is used to allow the well to flow through a side outlet, a Diverter Line
والو یا شیر منحرف کننده جریان
انحنایی که در هنگام حفاری مایل ایجاد می‌شود و اصطلاحا به آن پای سگ گویند
داگ لگ بالقوه که امکان ایجاد آن هنگام عملیات حفاری جهت دار وجود دارد
Time actually spent for drilling rotating time of the bit at bottom using a Down

Hole Motor or Turbine to drive the Bit besides the Rotary Table or the Top Drive. The whole drill string is rotating, Operations' abbreviation which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
Time actually spent for drilling rotating time of the Bit at bottom using a Down
Hole Motor or Turbine to drive the Bit without engaging the Rotary Table or the Top Drive, Operations' abbreviation which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
HIGH RESOLUTION DENSITY LOG, Log Curve name
DENSITY NEUTRON LOG, Log Curve name
drill out cement, also write as : D/O, actions or jobs' abbreviations which Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
اختصار در مورد عملیاتی است که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
loaded finger in a tubing end locator
A small house used for keeping lease records, changing clothes, or any other use around a lease
DL, A bend in pipe, a ditch, or a well
انحنایی که در هنگام حفاری مایل در چاه ایجاد می‌گردد و اصطلاحا به آن پای سگ گویند
داگ لگ بالقوه که امکان ایجاد آن هنگام عملیات حفاری جهت دار وجود دارد
شدت داگ لگ که بالاترین میزان انحناء است که بهنگام عملیات حفاری می‌تواند ایجاد گردد
دولومیت: که در آن علاوه بر کلسیم
A type of sedimentary rock similar to limestone but containing more than 50 percent magnesium carbonate; sometimes a reservoir rock for petroleum
A geologic structure resembling an inverted bowl; a short anticline that plunges on all sides
A reservoir formation in which fluid or plastic masses of rock material originated at unknown depths and pierced or lifted the overlying sedimentary strata
Any little pump; used for many kinds of small temporary pumping operations
Time actually spent for drilling other than Formation, rotating time of the Bit at bottom, Operations' abbreviation which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
Two lengths or joints of pipe joined together
A Monkeyboard with elevation equal to 2 Drilling Pipes
مانکی بورد یا سکوی دکلبان با اندازه دو شاخه
DRILL PIPE SIDEWALL NEUTRON, Log Curve name

Any of a variety of drilling bits that have no moving parts. As they are rotated on bottom, elements of the bit make hole by being pressed into the formation and being dragged across it. See also : Fishtail Bit
DRW, work on, Actions or jobs which Companymans write in their reports
The hoisting mechanism on a Drilling Rig. It is essentially a large winch that spools off or takes in the Drilling Line and thus raises or lowers the Drill Stem and Bit

Lost time due to drag. This might not be a lost time code rather than a problem, which has been experienced. if drag were experienced, however it does not have to cause a lost time. It can be recorded as an experience practices only, Operations' abbreviation which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
drill, actions or job's abbreviation which Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
اختصار در مورد عملیاتی است که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
DUAL RESISTIVITY INDUCTION LOG, Log Curve name

The angle at which a wellbore deviates from the vertical, expressed in degrees, as revealed by a directional survey. Also called angle of deviation, angle of drift, and inclination. See also : directional survey
DRI, actions or jobs which Companymans write in their reports
معمولا اختصار این لغت در مورد عملیاتی بکار میرود که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
To bore a hole in the earth, usually to find and remove subsurface formation fluids such as oil and gas
D/S, actions or jobs which Companymans write in their reports
حفاری و اسلاید نوعی حفاری که بروش لغزیدن انجام می‌شود که بیشتر در حفاری مایل بکار برده می‌شود
معمولا اختصار این لغت در مورد عملیاتی بکار میرود که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
D/S, actions or jobs which Companymans write in their reports
حفاری و اسلاید نوعی حفاری که بروش لغزیدن انجام می‌شود که بیشتر در حفاری مایل بکار برده می‌شود
معمولا اختصار این لغت در مورد عملیاتی بکار میرود که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
The cutting or boring element used for drilling. See also : Bit
D/C, actions or jobs which Companymans write in their reports
معمولا اختصار این لغت در مورد عملیاتی بکار میرود که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
لوله کالرحفاری یا لوله‌های وزنه حفاری که باعث سنگین‌تر شدن رشته حفاری می‌گردد
walled tube, usually steel, used between the Drill Pipe and the Bit in the drill stem to provide a pendulum effect to the drill stem and weight to the Bit
معمولا اختصار این لغت در مورد عملیاتی بکار میرود که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
D/F, actions or jobs which Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
To remove with the drill Bit the residual Cement that normally remains in the lower section of the Casing and the Well after the Casing has been cemented
. To remove the settlings and cavings that are plugged inside a hollow Fish, such as Drill Pipe during a Fishing operation

Seamless Steel or Aluminum pipe made up in the drill stem between the Kelly or Top Drive on the surface and the Drill Collars on the bottom. During drilling, it is usually rotated while drilling fluid is circulated through it. Drill Pipe joints are available in three ranges of length: 18 to 22 feet; 27 to 30 feet, and 38 to 45 feet. The most popular length is 27 to 30 feet. It is available with outside diameters ranging from 2 ⅞ to 5 ½ inches. Several joints are made up screwed together to form the Drill String
Heavy seamless tubing used to rotate the bit and circulate the drilling fluid. Joints of pipe approximately 30 feet 9 meters long are coupled together by means of tool joints
ابزار عقب کشیدن یا رها نمودن لوله‌های حفاری
The amount of pressure exerted inside the drill pipe as a result of circulating pressure, entry of formation pressure into the well, or both
An indicator, mounted in the mud circulating system, that measures and indicates the amount of pressure in the Drill Stem. See also : Drill Stem

propelled floating offshore drilling unit that is a ship constructed to permit a well to be drilled from it. While not as stable as Semisubmersible, drill ships are capable of drilling exploratory wells in deep, remote waters. They may have a ship hull, a catamaran hull, or a trimaran hull. See also : Floating Offshore Drilling Rig
کل رشته‌های بین هرز گرد و مته را گویند DS

All members in the assembly used for rotary drilling from the Swivel to the Bit, including the Kelly, Drill Pipe and Tool Joints, Drill Collars, Stabilizers, and various specialty items. Compare with : Drill String
کل رشته‌های حفاری بین هرز گرد و مته را گویند

A special Valve installed below the Kelly. Usually, the Valve is open so that drilling fluid can flow out of the Kelly and down the Drill Stem. It can, however, be manually closed with a special wrench when necessary. In one case, the Valve is closed and broken out, still attached to the Kelly to prevent drilling Mud in the Kelly from draining onto the Rig Floor. In another case, when Kick pressure inside the drill stem exists, the Drill Stem Safety Valve is close to prevent the pressure from escaping up the drill stem
The conventional method of Formation Testing. The basic Drill Stem Test Tool consists of a Packer or Packers, Valve or ports that may be opened and closed from the surface, and two or more pressure

recording devices. The tool is lowered on the drill string to the zone to be tested. The Packer or Packers are set to isolate the zone from the drilling fluid column. The valves or ports are then opened to allow for Formation flow while the recorders chart static pressures. A sampling chamber traps the Formation fluids at the end of the test. Analysis of the pressure charts is an important part of formation testing, DST
ستون یا رشته متشکل از لوله‌های حفاری و ابزار‌های پیوند

The column, or string, of drill pipe with attached tool joints that transmits fluid and rotational power from the kelly to the drill collars and bit. Often, especially in the oil patch, the term is loosely applied to both drill pipe and drill collars. Compare drill stem

The column, or string, of drill pipe with attached tool joints that transmits fluid and rotational power form the kelly to the drill collars and bit. Often, especially in the oil patch, the term is loosely applied to both drill pipe and drill collars. Compare also with : Drill Stem
A check valve in the drill string that will allow fluid to be pumped into the well but will prevent flow from entering the string
Pertaining to Packers and other tools left in the well to be broken up later by the drill Bit. Drillable equipment is made of Cast Iron, Aluminum, Plastic, or other soft, brittle material
حفاری جهت رسیدن به عمیق بیشتر
معمولا اختصار این لغت در مورد عملیاتی بکار میرود که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
Oil or gas in the mud circulated to the surface
سر حفار: که مسیولیت حفاری بعهدە وی می‌باشد

The employee directly in charge of a Drilling or Workover Rig and crew. His main duty is operation of the Drilling and Hoisting equipments, but he is also responsible for downhole condition of the Well, operation of Downhole Tools, and pipe measurements
Tool to make Holes, usually by revolving

Drills, Gimlets, and Augers have cutting edges that detach material to leave a Hole. Drilling usually requires high speed and low torque, with little material being removed during each revolution of the tool. The earliest, perhaps Bronze Age drill points had sharp edges that ultimately developed into arrow shapes with two distinct cutting edges. This shape was effective and remained popular until the late 19th century, when factory
fluted Twist drills became available at reasonable cost to displace the blacksmith
made articles. Rotating Drill Bits containing Diamonds or other hard materials are used for drilling rock, as for Tunnels or Oil Wells
A lease or a number of leases of adjoining tracts of land that constitute a unit of acreage sufficient to justify the expense of drilling a wildcat
A sudden increase in the drill bit's rate of penetration. it sometimes indicates that the bit has penetrated a high
pressure zone and thus warns of the possibility of a kick
An individual or group of individuals that own a drilling rig and contract their services for drilling wells
A driller, a Derrickman, and two or more helpers who operate a Drilling or Workover Rig for one tour each day

Circulating Fluid, one function of which is to force Cuttings out of the Well and to the surface. Other functions are to cool the Bit and to counteract downhole Formation pressure. While a mixture of Barite, Clay, Water, and Chemical Additives is the most common drilling fluid, Wells can also be drilled by using Air, Gas, Water, or Oil
Base Mud as the drilling fluid. See also : Mud
A cycle, or down the hole and back, is the time required for the pump to move the drilling fluid in the Hole. The cycle in minutes equals the Barrels of Mud in the Hole divided by barrels per minute
The supervisor of drilling or workover operations on a Rig. Also called a Rig Manager, Rig Supervisor, Rig Superintendent, or Tool Pusher
The operation during the drilling procedure at the point of drilling into the Pay Formation
A Wire Rope, WireLine used to support the drilling tools. Also called the Rotary Line
سرپرست حفاری که به آن تول پوشر نیز گویند
A specially compounded liquid circulated through the wellbore during rotary drilling operations. See also Mud
The operation during the drilling procedure when the Cement is drilled out of the Casing and the Well after the Casing has been cemented
. to remove the Settlings and Cavings that are plugged inside a hollow Fish, such as Drill Pipe during a Fishing operation
DRL, operations' abbreviations which usualy use in daily drilling reports
عملیات پایین رفتن در چاه جهت شروع حفاری
معمولا اختصار این لغت در مورد عملیاتی بکار میرود که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد

A fitting placed in the blowout preventer stack to provide space between preventers for facilitating stripping operations, to permit attachment of choke and kill lines, and for localizing possible erosion by fluid flow to the spool instead of to the more expensive pieces of equipment. See also : Spool
یک نوع تست مربوط به لایه‌های مخزن است که توسط ابزار دی. اس. تی. انجام می‌گیرد
Equipment designed to remove small quantities of liquids from a gas stream
دستگاهی که برای جمع آوری هیدروکربورهای مایع
که در حین عبور یک گاز مرطوب از درون یک لوله بکار می‌رود
A type of portable service or Workover Rig that is self

propelled, using power from the hoisting engines. The driver's cab and steering wheel are mounted on the same end as the mast support; thus the unit can be driven straight ahead to reach the wellhead. See carrier rig
همچنین اختصاری است برای دکل حفاری
drilling run, operation's Abbreviations use in reports
اختصار در مورد عملیاتی است که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد

Time actually spent for drilling rotating time of the Bit at bottom using rotary bottom hole assembly driven by Top Drive or Rotary Table, Operations' abbreviation which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports

All operations necessary for the Hole drilling : rotating the Bit for making Hole, Circulating, Tripping, Surveying, reaming up BHA, LOT, etc., Operations' abbreviation which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
نسبت تغییر در شیب بخشی از چاه که عمدا آنرا بحالت قایم نزدیک می‌کنند و معمولا بر حسب درجه در 100 فوت 30 متر بیان می‌شود

The rate of changing of the inclination in part of the Well, where the inclination angle is purposely returned to the vertical position and usually expressed in degrees per 100 feet 30 meters of course length
Drawworks Work on , actions or job's abbreviation which Companymans write in reports
اختصار در مورد عملیاتی است که در حال انجام است و در گزارش‌ها مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد
چاهی که خشک بوده و آنرا رها نموده اند
An exploratory or development well found to be incapable of producing either oil or gas in sufficient quantities to justify completion as an oil or gas well
drill stem, all of Drilling String between Swivel and the Bit
کل رشته‌های بین هرز گرد و مته را گویند
کل رشته‌های حفاری بین هرز گرد و مته را گویند
عملیاتی جهت بدست آوردن تمایل چاه
DUAL SPACED COMPENSATED NEUTRON, Log Curve name
dense, also mostly write as : dns
String filure, Pipe Wash, thread failed, etc., Operations' abbreviation which usually Companymans write in their daily drilling reports
DUAL SPACING LOG, Log Curve name
DUAL SPACING NEUTRON, Log Curve name
Drill Stem Test Tool, used for Formation Evaluation
DUAL SPACED THERMAL DECAY TIME, Log Curve name

A single Well that produces from two separate Formations at the same time. Production from each Zone is segregated by running two Tubing Strings with Packers inside the single string of production Casing, or by running one Tubing String with a Packer through one Zone while the other is produced through the Annulus. In a miniaturized dual completion, two separate 4 ½ " inch or smaller Casing Strings are run and cemented in the same Well
A blanking valve placed in a gas lift mandrel to block off annular communication to the tubing
A bailing device with a release valve, usually of the disk or flapper type, used to place, or spot material such as cement slurry at the bottom of the well
A reciprocating pump with two pistons or plungers and used extensively as a mud pump on drilling rigs
A piece of pipe that has been twisted off inside a female connection; or a short section of material, such as belting or pipe, used to lengthen existing equipment
Diverting Valve, sometimes use for : DV Collar
A generic term, originally a trademark name, used to describe a stage tool, used in selective zone primary cementing
DUAL WATER QUICK LOOK, Log Curve name

Trade name for a DownHole Motor driven by drilling fluid that imparts rotary motion to a drilling bit connected to the tool, thus eliminating the need to turn the entire drill stem to make hole. Used in straight and directional drilling
